009package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013/**
014 * This class represents a 2D filter kernel.
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 * @version 2022/09/10
018 */
019public class GaussianKernel2D extends Kernel2D {
020        
021        /**
022         * Constructor with individual sigmas for x/y.
023         * @param sigmaX sigma for X
024         * @param sigmaY sigma for Y
025         */
026        public GaussianKernel2D(double sigmaX, double sigmaY) {
027                super(makeGaussKernel2D(sigmaX, sigmaY));
028        }
029        
030        /**
031         * Constructor with common sigma for x/y.
032         * @param sigma common sigma for X/Y
033         */
034        public GaussianKernel2D(double sigma) {
035                super(makeGaussKernel2D(sigma, sigma));
036        }
037
038        /**
039         * Creates and returns a 2D Gaussian filter kernel large enough to avoid truncation effects. The associated array is
040         * odd-sized in both dimensions. The returned kernel is normalized.
041         *
042         * @param sigmaX the width (standard deviation) of the Gaussian in x-direction
043         * @param sigmaY the width (standard deviation) of the Gaussian in y-direction
044         * @return the Gaussian filter kernel
045         */
046        public static float[][] makeGaussKernel2D(double sigmaX, double sigmaY) {
047                return makeGaussKernel2D(sigmaX, sigmaY, true);
048        }
049
050        /**
051         * Creates and returns a 2D Gaussian filter kernel large enough to avoid truncation effects. The associated array is
052         * odd-sized in both dimensions. The returned kernel is optionally normalized.
053         *
054         * @param sigmaX the width (standard deviation) of the Gaussian in x-direction
055         * @param sigmaY the width (standard deviation) of the Gaussian in y-direction
056         * @param normalize set true to normalize the kernel
057         * @return the Gaussian filter kernel
058         */
059        public static float[][] makeGaussKernel2D(double sigmaX, double sigmaY, boolean normalize) {
060                final int radX = (int) Math.ceil(GaussianKernel1D.SIZE_FACTOR * sigmaX);
061                final int radY = (int) Math.ceil(GaussianKernel1D.SIZE_FACTOR * sigmaY);
062                final int sizeX = radX + radX + 1;
063                final int sizeY = radY + radY + 1;
064
065                final float[][] kernel = new float[sizeX][sizeY]; //center cell = kernel[rad][rad]
066                final double sigmaX2 = (sigmaX > 0.1) ? sqr(sigmaX) : 0.1;
067                final double sigmaY2 = (sigmaY > 0.1) ? sqr(sigmaY) : 0.1;
068                
069                for (int i = 0; i < sizeY; i++) {
070                        final double  b = sqr(radY - i) / (2 * sigmaY2);
071                        for (int j = 0; j < sizeX; j++) {
072                                final double a = sqr(radX - j) / (2 * sigmaX2);
073                                double g = Math.exp(-(a + b));
074                                kernel[i][j] = (float) g;
075                        }
076                }
077                return (normalize) ? normalize(kernel) : kernel;
078        }
079}
